author: Melanie Grayce West
title: Scholarships for Minority Students in Tel Aviv - WSJ
text:
Martin J. Whitman, the founder of the New York investment firm Third Avenue Management, is making a well-placed bet on peace and coexistence in the Middle East.
With a recent gift of $3 million to American Friends of Tel Aviv University, Mr. Whitman, 91 years old, has funded a center that awards scholarships to minority students enrolled in the universityâ€™s M.B.A. program.
In particular, scholarships are awarded to... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
